newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch, South African towage firms to cooperate.
newsitem.headline: Dutch, South African towage firms to cooperate.

text.p: Dutch towage firm SmitWijs said on Tuesday it had struck a global alliance with South Africa's Pentow Marine, a unit of shipping group Safmarine.
SmitWijs, which is a joint venture of Smit Internationale and unlisted towage firm Wijsmuller, said the SmitWijs/Pentow alliance would be based in Rotterdam and would be managed by SmitWijs.

The partners would jointly undertake large towage orders. The first would be shipping a mega-sized oil caisson from Alaska to South Korea. Another joint project will be towing an oil production and storage tanker from Japan to Norway.
SmitWijs owns six large towage vessels and has the international offshore oil and gas industry sectors as its main clients.
Pentow's two seagoing towage vessels will be pooled with SmitWijs' ships, the Dutch group said.
No financial details of the cooperation deal were disclosed.
